author: Staff Reporter
text:
Annur police have arrested M. Sampathkumar (22), who is working in a steel company in the city, and his father B. Murugesan (50), a daily wager of Muthukuttipalayam near Annur, on Saturday for allegedly abducting a 15-year-old girl to get her married to Sampathkumar.

The police said that the girl was studying Plus-One in a government school near Annur.

It is learnt that the father and son abducted her on February 23 and Sampath married her in a temple.

Meanwhile, the girl’s parents lodged a complaint with Annur police that their daughter was missing.

During inquiry the police came to know about the abduction and child marriage.

The police said that Sampath had also raped her.

Sampath and his father were booked under section 366 (abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage) of the Indian Penal Code.

Remanded

While Sampath was also booked under sections 5 and 6 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, his father was booked under section 17 of POCSO Act.

Both of them were remanded to judicial custody.
title: Two held for abduction of minor girl
